items.content_html:

That thing is amazing. Feels so nice in your hand. Like the perfect fit. Now I‚Äôm wondering if I should have switched to it. ü§£

items.title: Liquid Glass Thoughts
items.content_html:
I haven’t been minding Liquid Glass on the iPhone and iPad… ya, the animations are a little distracting, but fun.

On macOS it’s fine. I haven’t noticed any functionality issues..

But this screenshot showing my top left corner on my laptop screen has been bugging me. The rounded window corner against the square desktop just looks weird..

Although as I type this, I realize I have turned on the accessibility function to show the menu bar.. and just turned that off, no change.

And I also had reduce transparency on, turning that off helped a bit.. it’d be nice to have dark menu bar text in dark mode.
items.content_text: I haven't been minding Liquid Glass on the iPhone and iPad... ya, the animations are a little distracting, but fun. On macOS it's fine. I haven't noticed any functionality issues.. But this screenshot showing my top left corner on my laptop screen has been bugging me. The rounded window corner against the square desktop just looks weird.. Although as I type this, I realize I have turned on the accessibility function to show the menu bar.. and just turned that off, no change. And I also had reduce transparency on, turning that off helped a bit.. it'd be nice to have dark menu bar text in dark mode.

items.title: Paul Hudson's Everything But The Code
items.content_html:
Last night I bought Paul Hudson’s Everything But The Code: https://twostraws.gumroad.com/l/everything-but-the-code, and couldn’t stop reading it.

It’s really got me excited about getting back into ‘indie dev’. I’ve always been pretty good about ideas and the development part of indie dev, but never did the marketing,

Here’s some choice quotes that really resonated with me:

‚ÄúBut we already have enough code. If you’re reading this, you’re almost certainly either shipping apps already, or you’re about to do so in the next few months, so let’s fast forward past the code and focus on the most important part: help you build and ship apps that are smash hits‚Äù

‚ÄúCode got you started. This gets you paid‚Äù

From Arthaud Mesnard: ‚Äúin a world where anyone can build anything, most won‚Äôt.‚Äù

So, stay tuned, subscribe to the blog at luciendupont.com, and let’s see how this goes.

PS: If you want to join me, let me know! Go buy the book, and we’ll go through it together.
items.content_text:
Last night I bought Paul Hudson's Everything But The Code: [https://twostraws.gumroad.com/l/everything-but-the-code](https://twostraws.gumroad.com/l/everything-but-the-code), _and couldn't stop reading it_. 

It's really got me excited about getting back into 'indie dev'. I've always been pretty good about ideas and the development part of indie dev, but never did the marketing, 

Here's some choice quotes that really resonated with me: 

_‚ÄúBut we already have enough code. If you're reading this, you're almost certainly either shipping apps already, or you're about to do so in the next few months, so let's fast forward past the code and focus on the most important part: help you build and ship apps that are smash hits‚Äù_

_‚ÄúCode got you started. This gets you paid‚Äù_

From Arthaud Mesnard: _‚Äúin a world where anyone can build anything, most won‚Äôt.‚Äù_

So, stay tuned, subscribe to the blog at luciendupont.com, and let's see how this goes. 

PS: If you want to join me, let me know! Go buy the book, and we'll go through it together.

items.title: Software Patching the Voyager Probes
items.content_html:
A big part of me loves the fact that there’s engineering folks at JPL writing software patches for 1977 technology on the Voyager probes:

www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/nasa…

I’d love to learn more details on the tech, how the code it.. they must have been updating the process a lot since 1977.

I’ll happy drive up to JPL to visit and learn if anyone runs into this post. :)
items.content_text:
A big part of me loves the fact that there's engineering folks at JPL writing software patches for 1977 technology on the Voyager probes: 

[www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/nasa...](https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/nasas-voyager-team-focuses-on-software-patch-thrusters)

I'd love to learn more details on the tech, how the code it.. they must have been updating the process a lot since 1977. 

I'll happy drive up to JPL to visit and learn if anyone runs into this post. :)

items.title: Addiction
items.content_html:
Almost every year where I watch the WWDC keynote virtually I‚Äôd have twitter / Mastodon up, following along with peoples thoughts and reactions in real-ish time. But not really focusing on the presentation itself.

This year I‚Äôm going to do something different. I‚Äôm traveling to Cupertino to be with my coworkers, and I‚Äôll be closing my laptop and just be with them and the presentation.

I‚Äôve also found myself, when bored, turning to Reddit / Twitter / Mastodon. I‚Äôm going to set up One Sec to prevent that, and hopefully break me of that habit this week. I already feel like it‚Äôs going to be tough. üôÇ
items.content_text:
Almost every year where I watch the WWDC keynote virtually I‚Äôd have twitter / Mastodon up, following along with peoples thoughts and reactions in real-ish time. But not really focusing on the presentation itself. 

This year I‚Äôm going to do something different. I‚Äôm traveling to Cupertino to be with my coworkers, and I‚Äôll be closing my laptop and just be with them and the presentation. 

I‚Äôve also found myself, when bored, turning to Reddit / Twitter / Mastodon. I‚Äôm going to set up One Sec to prevent that, and hopefully break me of that habit this week. I already feel like it‚Äôs going to be tough. üôÇ

items.content_html: Today at work was “Focus Friday” - and I called it “bug fix Friday' - I spent the day fixing some bugs that had been annoying me and other people, and then added a small feature I’ve been wanting for a while.. (command + / - to increase / decrease font sizes in the app). It was a great day!

Ok - officially switched over my luciendupont.com domain name to this micro.blog instance. I’m loving the speed and features of micro.blog. And I’m really enjoying paying for something that a small team has built over the years :)

I urge you to check it out if you haven't.
